intro: Hesperis brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Hesperis brevipes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
